node.title: COVID-19 vaccine booster program begins today
node.description: Australia's booster vaccination program begins today, meaning anyone over 18 who received their second dose of a COVID-19 vaccine at least six months ago — May 8 — can book to have a third shot.

node.title: Ron Klein Says Voters 'Sent a Message' Tuesday, Congress Responded With Infrastructure Bill
node.description: "[Americans] are in a 'show me, don't tell me' mode. I think we are going to show them in the weeks and months ahead that we have made this progress on COVID." said Biden's chief of staff.

node.title: Wallabies lose tight Test to Scotland after controversial decision
node.description: Disappointment as Wallabies lose third consecutive match against Scotland with Dave Rennie bemoaning a harsh call to deny Michael Hooper a first half try.

node.title: 14yo who spent 'weeks' in confined detention centre cell allowed to return home
node.description: A Kimberley boy who is believed to have spent "weeks at a time" in a confined cell at Western Australia's only juvenile detention facility is released.

node.title: Couple's newly built family home so defective experts recommend it be demolished
node.description: A couple's dream to build a home for their blended family on a waterfront block has been shattered, with experts advising the only way to fix the building's defects is to demolish it and rebuild.

node.title: Black Caps into semi-finals at T20 World Cup
node.description: New Zealand crushed a billion Indian dreams and breezed into the semi-finals of the Twenty20 World Cup with an eight-wicket victory against Afghanistan.

node.title: Your Monday Briefing
node.description: China’s new official history.

node.title: NYC Top Cop Warns More Guns on Street 'Last Thing We Need' as SCOTUS Mulls Permit Law
node.description: Commissioner Dermot Shea said striking down New York's law "would really open the floodgates in terms of people being able to carry guns across the city."

node.title: Fights Erupt at Boston Rally Against Masks, Vaccines as Brass Band Joins Counter-Protestors
node.description: The group responsible for the event previously organized a "Straight Pride" parade and a fundraiser for Jan. 6 rioters.

node.title: Founding member of reggae pop band UB40, Astro, dies after short illness
node.description: Terence Wilson, who went by the stage name Astro for UB40, rose to fame in the 1980s with hits like Red Red Wine and Can't Help Falling In Love.

node.title: A climate change success story to remember amid the gloom of COP26
node.description: As COP26 enters its second week without much sign of progress, despair is in the air. But before you give up all hope, there is a shining example of a global climate agreement that actually succeeded.

node.title: More Americans Oppose Joe Biden than Donald Trump Running in 2024: Poll
node.description: Nearly two-thirds of Americans don't want Biden to seek another term in the next presidential election, according to a poll released Sunday.

node.title: US putting out the welcome mat for the first time in nearly two years
node.description: The United States is expecting a flood of international visitors today as the country's land and air borders are reopened to travellers for the first time since early 2020.

node.title: Indonesian boats burnt at sea in crackdown on illegal fishing in Australian waters
node.description: Australian authorities intercept 16 Indonesian fishing boats and seize hundreds of kilograms of seafood after a surge in illegal foreign fishing off the north-west coast.

node.title: All the COVID news you need from across Australia
node.description: Get up to speed on all the coronavirus news from across Australia. Follow live.

node.title: 'The wrong box may have been ticked': Bureaucratic bungle adds to mother's grief after stillbirth
node.description: Marcella Brassett says a disagreement between Centrelink and a hospital about whether her son was stillborn or briefly took one breath has added to her trauma. Now she is calling for more investment into stillbirths and neonatal deaths.

node.title: Police searching for vehicle seen near missing campers Russell Hill and Carol Clay
node.description: Police are trying to find a blue Nissan Patrol which was seen in the area where Russell Hill and Carol Clay disappeared in March 2020.

node.title: $25k event proposed to spur Invercargill City Council participation
node.description: The proposal follows comments from a community panel that more needed to be done to encourage a more diverse and representative council.

node.title: Vaccination rates a consideration as Cabinet meets, PM says
node.description: Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern says vaccination rates in Auckland will be taken into consideration when assessing whether restrictions in the city can be further loosened. Audio

node.title: Afghan Military Pilots, on the Run, Feel Abandoned by U.S.
node.description: Detained in Tajikistan, or hiding from the Taliban in Afghanistan, many pilots wonder why the military that trained them is not coming to their aid.

node.title: CNN Host Presses Sen. Mark Warner on Whether Democrats Have Become 'Too Woke' for Voters
node.description: "Glenn Youngkin touched a nerve that was felt in Virginia but frankly felt all over the country," the Democrat said amid recent Republican election gains.

node.title: Israel rejects Biden's plan to reopen US consulate for Palestinians in Jerusalem
node.description: Israel's Prime Minister Naftali Bennett declares there is no room in Jerusalem for another US mission, suggesting it should be in the occupied West Bank.

node.title: Queensland’s mask mandate could ease soon as 80 per cent single-dose vaccination nears
node.description: As Queensland edges closer to its 80 per cent single-dose COVID-19 vaccination milestone, Queensland Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk has flagged potential changes to the mask mandate.

node.title: Republicans Who Backed Infrastructure Face Attacks Conflating It With Social Spending Bill
node.description: "Many are saying the stuff in the second bill was in this [infrastructure] bill. It's disinformation intended to divide and raise their ratings," said Rep. Don Bacon.

node.title: 'Climate-positive' Olympics demand sets high bar on making Brisbane 2032 sustainable
node.description: Brisbane's 2032 Olympics will be the first Games contractually obliged to operate as "climate positive", which is part of a move to avoid the legacies of huge debts and abandoned stadiums faced by some previous host cities.

node.title: How Tony Abbott helped build a bridge to net zero
node.description: Ironically, given his attitude to climate change, former Prime Minister Tony Abbott inadvertently created the framework for a carbon price when he axed Julia Gillard's carbon tax, writes Ian Verrender.

node.title: Latrobe Valley coal community already looking to future amid fossil fuel talks at COP26
node.description:
Coal has been the lifeblood of Morwell for a long time. But the Victorian community, which was seeing the writing on the wall long before the COP26 summit, is looking to build a new future.

Debates and decisions at the COP26 global climate summit in Glasgow are resonating in coal communities like Morwell, as the world attempts to stop burning fossil fuels for energy.

node.title: 'A great father': WA shark bite victim named as wife thanks Fremantle locals and police
node.description: Paul Millachip, 57, was swimming off Port Beach around 10am on Saturday when he was bitten by a shark, with his wife describing him as "a lovely man, and a great father".

node.title: Five graphs that show Victoria is on the move again
node.description: From the feet hitting the pavement, to the cars on the roads and planes in the sky — these are the graphs that show how Victorians are reclaiming their freedom of movement after weeks of lockdown.

node.title: 'My future is at stake': What it's like growing up in the Pacific, on the frontline of climate change
node.description: Children and young people in the Pacific have grown up in the shadow of climate change, watching rising sea levels swallow landscapes and waiting in fear for the next natural disaster to strike.

node.title: Representation, equality and respect: Being queer in politics
node.description: While every pollie's time in office is different, for Chansey Paech, Dr Kerryn Phelps and Tim Wilson there are a few similarities between their experiences and the way they've approached public life.

node.title: Assisted dying now an option for some with a terminal illness
node.description: People enduring unbearable suffering from a terminal illness are now able to ask for medical help to end their lives.

node.title: Washington Gov. Jay Inslee Pledges Zero-Emission Public Fleets, Cites 'Extreme Weather'
node.description: Forty percent of Washington's state-owned light-duty vehicles will be electric-powered by 2025.

node.title: Justine’s Ruszczyk’s family says killer cop’s reduced sentence not enough for ‘obscene’ shooting
node.description: This is how an Australian family challenged a US policing system and its use of brutal force. But for Justine’s Ruszczyk's family there is more to be done to ensure their daughter’s "obscene" death was not in vain.

node.title: COVID-19 restrictions are being eased in NSW today — this is what's changing
node.description: New freedoms for those who are fully vaccinated come into effect after the NSW government moves its COVID-19 roadmap forward. Here's what's changed.

node.title: The Biden administration is ‘prepared to defend’ the vaccine rules for big employers, the surgeon general says.
node.description: The administration last week set Jan. 4 as the deadline for companies with 100 or more employees to mandate Covid vaccinations or implement weekly testing of workers.

node.title: Astroworld Victims Include High Schoolers and a College Student
node.description: The music festival at Astroworld in Houston left eight people dead. Here is what is known about them so far.

node.title: DHBs, funeral homes buy refrigerated containers for Covid-19 bodies
node.description: Refrigerated containers are being hired, bought, and scoped out to store Covid-19 bodies across the country.

node.title: In photos: The breathtaking view from above the New York City Marathon.
node.description: We sent photographers up in the air (in a helicopter and on a bridge) to capture the scope of the New York City Marathon from above.

node.title: Government must prepare for migrants 'ahead of time' - Productivity Commission
node.description: Immigration policy is "disconnected" from infrastructure and housing supply, according to findings from the Productivity Commission.

node.title: Covid-19: More testing needed in Tairāwhiti, Taranaki and Hawke's Bay
node.description: People in Gisborne, Stratford and Napier are still being urged to get tested for Covid-19, after the virus was detected in wastewater samples last week.

node.title: Facebook's metaverse - is it real, or a smokescreen?
node.description: The Detail - Facebook is promising to bring us into the future with the metaverse, but is that a future we want?

node.title: Gottlieb predicts "broad immunity" among children as more get vaccinated
node.description: "I think you're going to see broad immunity get put into the child population," Gottlieb said.

node.title: Witnesses to the End
node.description: The young Marines in Kabul were left to determine who was evacuated from Afghanistan and who was left behind. The cost was high.

node.title: Biden Energy Sec Warns Americans Will Pay More to Heat Homes: 'This Is Going to Happen'
node.description: The EIA's recent report stated U.S. households that rely on natural gas could spend an average of $746 to heat their homes this winter—up 30 percent from the previous one.

node.title: 1972 Big Bird Vaccination Video Resurfaces Amid Brouhaha Over COVID Vaccine 'Propaganda'
node.description: Social media users took aim at Ted Cruz and vaccination opponents who criticized the beloved Sesame Street character.

node.title: Liz Cheney Groups Jan. 6 'False Flag' Claims With 9/11 'Inside Job' Theory
node.description: The Republican congresswoman said it's "un-American" to spread lies about the attack on the U.S. Capitol from 10 months ago.

node.title: Kenyans Albert Korir and Peres Jepchirchir win NYC Marathon
node.description: Jepchirchir became the only woman to take a marathon major in the fall after earning an Olympic gold medal.

node.title: All Blacks serve up woeful display as focus switches to Black Ferns
node.description: It says something about the expectations put on the All Blacks that their 47-9 win over Italy has been widely greeted with ridicule and dismay, Jamie Wall writes.

node.title: Police search underway after 16-year-old's shooting
node.description: Police are carrying out a search warrant at an address in Christchurch following the death of a 16-year-old who was fatally shot in the suburb of Casebrook on Friday night.

node.title: Auckland DHBs hit 90 percent first vaccination milestone
node.description: Counties Manukau DHB has hit a 90 percent target for Covid-19 vaccine first doses, bringing all of Tāmaki Makaurau over the line for first doses.

node.title: FedEx CEO says company can meet holiday demand
node.description: FedEx CEO Fred Smith says the company can make holiday deliveries on time, as long as it can hire the employees needed to do so.

node.title: TikTok’s running hero, Mrs. Space Cadet, competes in her first marathon.
node.description: Thousands have followed along as Erin Azar, a self-described “slightly overweight person who drinks too much beer,” trained for the marathon.

node.title: Wary of Afghan spin threat, New Zealand back their own strengths
node.description: New Zealand are aware of the threat posed by Afghanistan's spin attack, but the Black Caps are confident of sealing a semi-final spot in the Twenty20 World Cup with a win in Abu Dhabi, leg-spinner Ish…

node.title: Covid-19: Avondale student tests positive, school closed Monday
node.description: A student at Avondale College in West Auckland has tested positive for Covid-19 and the school will be closed tomorrow.

node.title: Stephen Karpiak, Pathbreaking H.I.V. Researcher, Dies at 74
node.description: His work helped change people’s attitude toward older people living with the virus that causes AIDS.

node.title: Trump Says Biden's Afghanistan 'Disaster' Will Lead to China Taking Over Bagram Air Base
node.description: "We would have kept Bagram because it is next to China and it is one hour away from their nuclear facility, and we gave that up too," the former president claimed in a Fox News interview.

node.title: A matter of faith: The Māngere congregation with 100% vaccinations
node.description: Church minister Suiva'aia Te'o says proactive communication, compassion and clear information have led to a fully vaccinated congregation.

node.title: Transcript: FedEx CEO Fred Smith on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with FedEx chairman and CEO Fred Smith that aired Sunday, November 7, 2021, on "Face the Nation."

node.title: Kaine says Democrats "blew the timing" of Biden bills
node.description: Kaine said Democrats should've passed the two plans in early October.

node.title: Running her first marathon, Abby Wambach plans to leave her teammates behind.
node.description: The former U.S. women’s soccer star was on the start line of the New York City Marathon with three of her former teammates.

node.title: Here are the celebrity runners in this year’s marathon.
node.description: Former U.S. women’s national soccer team members, musicians from Mumford and Sons, and a Broadway star are among some of the bold names running in the New York City Marathon.

node.title: Adam Schiff Mocks Republicans' Infrastructure Vows Under Trump: 'They Never Delivered'
node.description: "They promised a big investment in roads, bridges, and highways," the Democrat said of the former president and GOP congressional members. "And they never delivered. We did. And that's a Big F-ing Deal."

node.title: Ko lights up in third round blitz, Alker one shot off lead
node.description: Lydia Ko has stormed into a four-shot lead after a firing a course record in the third round of the Ladies European Tour event in Saudi Arabia.

node.title: Transcript: Dr. Scott Gottlieb on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with former FDA Commissioner Dr. Scott Gottlieb on Sunday, November 7, 2021.

node.title: Transcript: Tim Kaine on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Virginia Senator Tim Kaine that aired Sunday, November 7 2021, on "Face the Nation."

node.title: What to Cook This Week
node.description: With fall upon us in earnest, warm up with lamb meatballs and spiced tomato sauce.

node.title: ‘On Consolation’ Searches for Solace in the Face of Grief and Misery
node.description: In his new book, Michael Ignatieff says that we can find beauty and transcendence even when at our lowest depths.

node.title: Peres Jepchirchir of Kenya wins the women’s race at the New York City Marathon.
node.description: Jepchirchir’s victory comes just three months after she won gold in the women’s marathon at the Tokyo Olympics.

node.title: The Joy of Buying Nothing New for the Holidays
node.description: This is not about being a Grinch, canceling Christmas or trying to pass a minimalist purity test.

node.title: Albert Korir of Kenya wins the men’s race at the New York City Marathon.
node.description: It was a breakthrough performance for Korir, 27, who was the runner-up in New York in 2019.

node.title: Don’t Be So Quick to Doubt China’s Climate Change Dedication
node.description: President Biden was among those expressing disappointment over China’s lack of commitment to climate change.

node.title: How Covid Raised the Stakes of the War Between Faith and Science
node.description: The debate isn’t just about creationism and stem cells anymore.

node.title: Two spotted hyenas at the Denver Zoo are the first known to have Covid-19.
node.description: The adult hyenas, who tested positive for the coronavirus, have so far exhibited mild symptoms of Covid, but they are believed to be “in good shape and improving,” a zoo spokesman said.

node.title: Britain’s health secretary urges people to get booster shots amid a surge.
node.description: “If we all come together and play our part, we can get through this challenging winter, avoid a return to restrictions and enjoy Christmas,” said Sajid Javid, the health secretary.

node.title: Chris Christie Urges Trump to 'Tell the Truth About the Election and Move On'
node.description: The former New Jersey governor also called Glenn Youngkin's recent gubernatorial election win in Virginia "the start of a new era" for Republicans.

node.title: GOP Governor Larry Hogan Cautions Against Trump Involvement in 2022 Midterms
node.description: The Maryland governor warned that the former president may "hurt" Republicans by backing "unelectable" candidates in swing districts.

node.title: Two five-wicket hauls for Kerr in Wellington wins
node.description: White Ferns all-rounder Melie Kerr has backed up yesterday's five-wicket bag for Wellington with a second today as the Blaze recorded back-to-back one-day wins over Canterbury in Rangiora.

node.title: Video of Linkin Park Stopping Concert Over Crowd Safety Watched 3M Times
node.description: The clip resurfaced after eight people died when fans suddenly surged toward the stage to watch rapper Travis Scott perform at Astroworld music festival.

node.title: What’s in a Name? For the Koreans of Sakhalin, an Anguished History
node.description: Stranded for decades on the island in Russia’s Far East, some bear three names, Japanese, Russian and Korean, representing different historical chapters. Now, many are planning their return.

node.title: Michael Rutter, Pioneering Child Psychiatrist, Is Dead at 88
node.description: His wide-ranging research helped transform his field, a colleague said, by “insisting on using data to drive thinking about diagnosis and treatment.”

node.title: International travelers eagerly await reunions with their loved ones as the U.S. travel changes near.
node.description: On Monday, travelers from many other countries who are fully vaccinated against the coronavirus will be allowed to enter the United States.

node.title: Palestinians Cry Foul as Israel Rejects Reopening of U.S. Consulate Trump Closed in Jerusalem
node.description: Israeli Prime Minister Naftali Bennett has repeatedly said that there is "no room" for a consulate that would serve as a diplomatic mission for Palestinians in the contested city.

node.title: Terence Blanchard's opera: "Fire Shut Up in My Bones"
node.description: In its 138 years, New York's Metropolitan Opera had never staged an opera by a Black composer – until now. The jazz trumpeter talks about his opera, based on Charles Blow's memoir of growing up in small-town Louisiana in the 1970s and '80s.

node.title: "Madam": How the oldest profession entered the Jazz Age
node.description: In her book, "Madam," Pulitzer Prize-winner Debby Applegate traces Polly Adler's rise from immigrant sweatshop employee to owner of one of New York City's most popular bordellos, catering to politicians, celebrities, and the mob.

node.title: An Indigenous Canadian Director Channels Traumatic Memories Into Film
node.description: Tracey Deer based “Beans” on her experiences as a child during the 1990 Oka crisis, a confrontation between the Mohawk people and the government.

node.title: Parents Arrested in Baby's Death in 30-Year-Old Cold Case
node.description: The two identified through DNA analysis as the infant's father and mother were arrested in North Carolina last month.

node.title: Top Biden aide "very confident" infrastructure projects will begin by spring
node.description: The House passed the $1.2 trillion bipartisan infrastructure bill late Friday, sending the legislation to President Biden for his signature.

node.title: Benedict Cumberbatch: "What an amazing way to live a life"
node.description: The son of working actors, who rocketed to worldwide fame as Sherlock Holmes and Doctor Strange, is being praised for his performance as a bullying cowboy in Jane Campion's psychological drama, "The Power of the Dog."

node.title: Five down and one to go: This is Shalane Flanagan’s final test.
node.description: With all six of the world’s major marathons packed into as many weeks this fall because of the pandemic, Flanagan saw an opportunity to do something extraordinary: run them all.

node.title: Transcript: Cedric Richmond on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with White House senior adviser Cedric Richmond that aired Sunday, November 7, 2021, on "Face the Nation."

node.title: A ‘Bachelorette’ star says of her first marathon: It’s just about ‘putting yourself out there.’
node.description: Tayshia Adams will run the race with her fiancé Zac Clark, who she became engaged to on season 16 of the show.

node.title: Bob Costas, still speaking his mind
node.description: The veteran sportscaster and commentator is bringing his passion to a new HBO discussion show, "Back on the Record with Bob Costas," examining the junctions of sports and culture.

node.title: Batteries and the new "lithium gold-rush"
node.description: With electric cars the future of the auto industry, companies are ramping up the manufacture of batteries and the mining of lithium, creating opportunities to combat climate change, while also threatening serious environmental impacts.

node.title: SAINT: Hope for new treatment of depression
node.description: A new experimental treatment using a fast-acting approach with targeted magnetic stimulation of the brain, called Stanford Accelerated Intelligent Neuromodulation Therapy, has achieved significant success in trials.

node.title: Why we yawn
node.description: Experts say yawning not only helps your brain, but also is a sign of empathy and, yes, increased alertness.

node.title: Homes That Sold for Around $450,000
node.description: Recent residential sales in New York City and the region.

node.title: Museum Finds New Species of Prehistoric Snails in its Own Storeroom
node.description: Astonished experts found a dusty box abandoned for decades contained previously unknown mollusks from 15 million years ago.

node.title: New Zealand advances to T20 World Cup semi-finals at expense of India
node.description: Captain Kane Williamson guides New Zealand to an eight-wicket victory at the Zayed Cricket Stadium in Abu Dhabi in a result that eliminates India ahead of its match against Namibia on Monday.

node.title: Allegations of Liberal Party branch stacking involving Assistant Treasurer Michael Sukkar aired in defamation case
node.description: The allegations against the federal MP are detailed in documents filed in the Federal Court as part of defamation proceedings brought by a former Liberal Party factional figure.
